title: Starter Motor - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Seat and Battery - remove - D72; D92; DB; DB2; DBX; DC3; DC4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D54; D64; DC3; DC4; DP4; D72; D92; DB2; DU3; DT3; DP3; DP2; DZ; DBX; DB; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Starter Motor Remove D Series (not DS)
Ease the rubber boot from the starter cable, release the nut and disconnect the cable.
Protect the crankcase painted surfaces from damage, using a suitable self-adhesive tape such as masking tape.
Release the two bolts securing the starter motor to the crankcase.
Damage to painted surfaces could result from inadequate care during removal or installation of the starter motor. Always protect the crankcase from damage during removal or installation.
Carefully manoeuvre the starter motor out to the right hand side of the motorcycle.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DR (do not use - delete if found in use); DD2; DD (do not use - delete if found in use); DF2; DF; DEX; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DC3; DC; DZA; DZ; DA2; DBX; DB2; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP
